page.title: 16A FARM NEAR BELLSQUARRY
page.content: {Murieston Castle Farm},situated 1.5km south of Bellsquarry Village, is a dairy farm. Its main crops are winter barley and grass to feed the cattle. This year,for the first time, Mr. Harry Russell,has grown{oilseed {rape}- to produce{cooking oil.}It was used, at first, as a{break crop}- it gives the soil a rest between the growing of other crops, such as barley. Its yields are high and it has become a very profitable crop. It is cut by a machine called a{Swather}and then{Combined}after it has dried. The oil is now ready to be extracted from the pod. The{European Economic {Community}has been encouraging farmers to grow oilseed rape, and we are now seeing fields of this pretty yellow flowered crop all over the countryside.
